Change History

Services

SSIDPrioritization

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/SSIDPrioritization
Wireless SSID Prioritization Service

Service Actions

  • GetSSIDPrioritizationSettings
  • SetSSIDPrioritizationSettings

Actions

GetSSIDPrioritizationSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/GetSSIDPrioritizationSettings
This action gets the SSID prioritization settings of the wireless network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
maxPrioritizedSSIDs int no The maximum number or prioritized SSIDs allowed on the network.
isSSIDPrioritizationEnabled bool no Whether SSID prioritization is currently enabled.
prioritizedSSIDs PrioritizedSSID[] no A list of SSIDs currently configured -- ordered by priority.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/GetSSIDPrioritizationSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/GetSSIDPrioritizationSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "maxPrioritizedSSIDs": 4,
    "isSSIDPrioritizationEnabled": true,
    "prioritizedSSIDs": [
      {
        "ssid": "MyHomeWiFi1",
        "passphrase": "ThisIsThePassphrase!",
        "isEnabled": true
      }
    ]
  }
}

SetSSIDPrioritizationSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/SetSSIDPrioritizationSettings
This action sets the SSID prioritization settings for the wireless network.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isSSIDPrioritizationEnabled bool no Whether SSID prioritization should be enabled.
prioritizedSSIDs PrioritizedSSID[] no A list of SSIDs to be configured -- ordered by priority.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/SetSSIDPrioritizationSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDeviceNotInMasterMode This action only works in Master mode.
ErrorInvalidPassphrase One of the input passphrase values was invalid.
ErrorInvalidSSID One of the input ssid values was invalid.
ErrorMissingSSIDs The prioritizedSSIDs list was empty when isSSIDPrioritizationEnabled = true.
ErrorTooManySSIDs The number of items in prioritizedSSIDs exceeded the maximum allowed.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/SetSSIDPrioritizationSettings"

{
  "isSSIDPrioritizationEnabled": true,
  "prioritizedSSIDs": [
    {
      "ssid": "MyHomeWiFi1",
      "passphrase": "ThisIsThePassphrase!",
      "isEnabled": true
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

PrioritizedSSID

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/ssidprioritization/PrioritizedSSID
This service provides access to WiFi SSID prioritization functions and settings. Information about a prioritized SSID on the wireless network.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
ssid string no The wireless SSID.
passphrase string no The wireless passphrase.
isEnabled bool no Whether the SSID is enabled on the wireless network.
